## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
df <-read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Smillersfsu/Biol708/refs/heads/main/Code/ELKVEG2016.csv")

```

```{r}
ggplot(data =df) +
  geom_point(aes(x =SiteID , y = MLLW, color= Maximum.Canopy.Height)) +
    labs(x = "Elkhorn Slough Transects",
       y = "Mean Low Low Water (MLLW)",
       title = "Variance of Maximum Canopy Height Across MLLW Across Transects of Elkhorn Slough") + 
    theme_bw() + scale_color_gradient(low ="brown", high = "green") + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 7)) + 
  theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 7))
```

`ho: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=8}

ggplot(data =df) + 
  geom_point(aes(size= 6, x = SiteID, y = MLLW, color = Cover)) + 
    labs(x = "Elkhorn Slough Transects",
       y = "Mean Low Low Water (MLLW)",
       title = "Differences in Cover of Pickleweed in relation to MLLW in Elkhorn Slough Transects") +
    theme_bw() + scale_color_gradient(low ="brown", high = "green") +
    theme(legend.title=element_text("% Cover")) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 25, hjust = 1, size = 11)) +theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size=18))+theme(axis.title.x.bottom=element_text(size = 14))+theme(axis.title.y.left = element_text(size = 14))
```

```{r}
library(ggridges)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(forcats)
```

```{library(ggplot)}

df<-read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Smillersfsu/Biol708/refs/heads/main/Code/ELKVEG2016.csv", header =TRUE, sep = ",")

data <- data %>% 
  gather(key="text", value="value") %>%
  mutate(text = gsub("\\.", " ", text)) %>% 
  filter(text %in% c("SiteID"))

data %>% 
  mutate(text = fct_reorder(text, value)) %>% 
  ggplot( aes(y= text, x= value, fill= text)) + 
  geom_denisty_ridges(alpha=0.6, stat="binline", bins=20) + 
  theme_ridges() + 
  theme(legend.position = "none", panel.spacing = unit(0.1, "lines"), strip.text.x=element_text(size =8)) +
  xlab("Distance") + ylab("Othrometric.Height")

```
